titleStmt.title: The famous history of George Lord Faukonbridge, bastard son to Richard Cordelion King of England Begotten in his royal tower, vpon the princely Clarabel, daughter to Don Iohn Duke of Austria, surnamed the worldes faire concubine. Shewing his knightly adventures, dignified victories, with his life and death, spent in the honor of God and his countrey: never wearing any other garmet, but that lyons skinne, by which his kingly father challenged his lyon-like title.

The famous history of George Lord Faukonbridge, bastard son to Richard Cordelion King of England Begotten in his royal tower, vpon the princely Clarabel, daughter to Don Iohn Duke of Austria, surnamed the worldes faire concubine. Shewing his knightly adventures, dignified victories, with his life and death, spent in the honor of God and his countrey: never wearing any other garmet, but that lyons skinne, by which his kingly father challenged his lyon-like title.

publicationStmt.publisher: By I. B[eale] and are to be sold by Iames Dauies, at his shop neere Fleet Conduit,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: The famous historie of Lord Faukonbridge.
Some pages missing in number only.
Woodcut on title page (and on page 43 verso).
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
